page.title: 10THE CHURCH AT LOWER TATHAM.
page.content: The tower of the church of St James the Less in the diocese of Blackburn dates back to 1220. The church lies one and a half miles from Wennington. The parish covers about 3,000 acres and 150 people. Generally 20 people attend the Sunday service, although numbers increase to about 50 at special or family services, where the vicar directs his attention towards the children. It is a basic Anglican church using the Book of Common Prayer, preferred by the older people but it has been criticised for making no attempt to attract or interest the youth of the parish. The church officials prefer a steady predictable income from offerings and the collection rather than from fund-raising events like garden fetes. Little change seems likely.
